intro: [WRONG START] Valerianella longiflora f. inexpensa, commonly known as the broadleaf valerian, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features rosettes of broad, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in shady garden settings.
